entries.meaning: (cooking) A dish made by boiling bread in water and combining the pulp with milk, stock, butter or sometimes egg yolks. [from 16th c.]
(obsolete, figurative) Something blandly nourishing; pap. [18th–19th c.]
examples: He paid his Debts, call'd in some single Acquaintance, told him he was dying & drove away that Panada Conversation which Friends think proper to administer at Sick Bed-Sides, with becoming Steadiness.

entries.meaning: A thick paste or sauce made from boiling flour or breadcrumbs. [from 19th c.]
